title: Instagram: How to Unlock a Temporarily Locked or Disabled Account

steps.title: Using a third-party app with your Instagram account.
steps.content: Using a third-party app with your Instagram account. If you were using an app that automatically likes, follows, unfollows, or performs other actions on your account, Instagram may think the app's activities are too bot-like or otherwise suspicious. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Too many failed login attempts.
steps.content: Too many failed login attempts. If you've entered the wrong password too many times while trying to sign in, Instagram may think someone is trying to hack your account. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Posting the same comment many times.
steps.content: Posting the same comment many times. Instagram's algorithm might think you're spamming users if you're commenting the same thing under multiple posts. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Hacking or phishing.
steps.content: Hacking or phishing. If a hacker was able to get your password through phishing or other shady means, the hacker may have been using your account to spam, scam, or do other things that violate Instagram's terms.

steps.title: Delete any third-party apps you were using with your Instagram account.
steps.content: Delete any third-party apps you were using with your Instagram account. For example, if you were using an automatic liking, following, or commenting tool, you'll want to remove that from your phone or tablet. Additionally, visit https://www.instagram.com/accounts/manage_access in a web browser, log in with your Instagram account, and remove any of the apps listed under "Active" to revoke their access to your account.

steps.title: Try to log in to Instagram.
steps.content: Try to log in to Instagram. If your account is temporarily locked, you will see a message that says "Your Account Has Been Temporarily Locked" when you try to sign in to your account. If you are getting an error that says your account has been disabled or deactivated rather than locked, the recovery process is different. See Fixing the "Your Account Has Been Disabled" Error .

steps.title: Tap the blue Continue button.
steps.content: Tap the blue Continue button. Now you'll be asked to confirm your account. You'll see your email address or phone number on the screen.

steps.title: Tap Send Security Code.
steps.content: Tap Send Security Code . In a few moments, you'll receive the code via email or SMS text message.

steps.title: Enter the code to confirm your account.
steps.content: Enter the code to confirm your account. Once the code is confirmed, you should be able to use your Instagram account normally. If you don't receive a code right away, wait a few hours before trying again. If you don't have access to the email address or phone number on file, continue to the next step.

steps.title: Don't have access to the email address or phone number for your account?
steps.content: Don't have access to the email address or phone number for your account? You won't be able to receive a confirmation code, but you can follow Instagram's process for proving your identity. [4] X Research source This may require sending ID and/or a video selfieâ€”the exact process may vary. [5] X Research source To get started: [6] X Research source Tap Forgot password? on the login screen. Enter your account's username or email. You can also tap Search by mobile number instead or Log in with Facebook . Tap Try another way when Instagram says it will send a code to your email. Tap No longer have access to these? at the bottom of the screen. Tap Try another way at the bottom of the next screen, unless one of the emails listed is one you recognize and still have access to. Choose to take a selfie video or get help from your friends. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the account retrieval process.

steps.title: Wait for an email reply from Instagram.
steps.content: Wait for an email reply from Instagram. It may take several days to a few weeks for you to receive a reply from Instagram support. Check your email account regularly, and double-check your Spam or Junk folder to make sure it isn't mistakenly categorized as such.

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app. If your account was deactivated or disabled for not following Instagram's guidelines and you believe this is a mistake, open the Instagram app and log in, then follow the on-screen instructions. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Select Yes to provide your ID.
steps.content: Select Yes to provide your ID. This will be required for reactivating your mistakenly-terminated account. You will need to provide a form of government-issued ID that clearly states your name, birthdate, and photo. The ID must be a color ID. [8] X Research source For a full list of accepted ID forms, visit https://www.facebook.com/help/159096464162185 .

steps.title: Fill out the form.
steps.content: Fill out the form. After filling out each form field, click or tap Chose Files and select your scanned or photographed ID. Before you continue, you will need to check the box next to "I understand I can't get help with my account if I haven't uploaded a valid ID."

steps.title: Click or tap Send.
steps.content: Click or tap Send . This sends your request to Instagram's support team. Instagram's support team will review your appeal and contact you via email with their decision. It may take several days to a few weeks for you to receive a reply from Instagram support. Check your email account regularly, and double-check your Spam or Junk folder to make sure it isn't mistakenly categorized as such. If your appeal doesn't seem to be making any headway, go to https://help.instagram.com/contact/505535973176353 and select Data access > I have an Instagram account but I can't access my data , then fill out the required information. Once Instagram sends you an email with a confirmation number for your request, reply to the email explaining that your account was wrongfully disabled. You may have to do this multiple times. Some users have found that sending emails to their state's attorney general or local authorities seemed to get Instagram to reply more quickly. [9] X Research source
